import { Container } from '../../style'; const CopyrightGuidance = () => { return (

Copyright protections

According to the World Intellectual Property Organization, copyright protection extends to books, music, paintings, sculpture, and films, to computer programs, databases, advertisements, maps, and technical drawings. The protection lasts until 50 years until the author’s death. However, copyrighted materials may still be used for criticism or commentary under the fair use principle, but is subject to further scrutiny.

 

Materials not allowed in class

As a general rule, using materials that are copyrighted by an author is not allowed unless utilized under the fair use principle. In your class listings, make sure that you have permission on the images that you will be using or that the materials do not have copyright protection. The same is true for materials that will be used during the class except if the material will be used for criticism or commentary.

 

Response to Copyrighted materials

If your class has been reported to have contained materials that violate intellectual property rights, then we will immediately remove the mentioned material from your class. This could mean that the class could be suspended or taken down until the issue has been resolved. This will happen when we receive a DMCA notification regarding the illegal use of material, trademark logo, or wordmark.{' '}

 

Copyright-free materials

To help you in avoiding copyright complaints, here are some sites that you can use to get copyright-free materials:

  • Pixabay
  • Unsplash
  • Maxpixel
  • Freeimages
  • Lifeofpix
  • Stocksnap

 

References

  • https://www.wipo.int/copyright/en/faq_copyright.html
  • http://www.federislaw.com.ph/faqs-resources/copyright/#:~:text=In%20the%20Philippines%2C%20copyright%20protection,also%20applies%20to%20posthumous%20works.
  • http://web.nlp.gov.ph/nlp/?q=node/646
  • https://fairuse.stanford.edu/overview/fair-use/#:~:text=Fair%20use%20is%20a%20copyright,novelist's%20work%20without%20asking%20permission
  • https://www.copyright.gov/fair-use/more-info.html
); }; export default CopyrightGuidance;
